intro: Cressa minima, commonly known as small cress, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. The plant features tiny, bright green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters near the base of the plant. Cressa minima is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
